intro: Zeuxine cognata, commonly known as the broad-leaved zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly China and Japan. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy flowers. The plant features slender stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens, creating a delicate and attractive appearance. Zeuxine cognata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
